item.title: Installing Halide in Ubuntu/Pop OS with vcpkg
item.description: Instructions from Halide blogs Install cmake if your don’t have it already. Download the precompiled binaries from: https://cmake.org/download/ If you prefer installing from the source, follow the instructions on the page. The second step is to install halide with vcpkg. Run the following command once you have installed vcpkg. xxx@xxx-os:~$ ./vcpkg/vcpkg install halide:x64-linux After some log .. Total elapsed time: 55.61 min The package halide provides CMake targets: set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 17) set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED YES) set(CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS NO) find_package(Halide REQUIRED) # JIT mode: add_executable(my_halide_app main.

item.title: Halide
item.description: Sources: Halide Cpp Con 2020 1 Martin Fowler Internal DSLs 2 Let’s talk domain specific languages.. If you don’t know about these, let’s just say domain specific languages are programming languages that are specialized and restricted to best meet the needs of a specific domain. The goal of a DSL is exploit those restrictions for faster performance, easier maintenance, safety guarentees and so on. The most popular one most of you all know is HTML – short for HyperText Markup Language.
